chessosisnbproject.logic

Class MoveGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • chessosisnbproject.logic.MoveGenerator

  • public class MoveGenerator
extends Object
    This class is responsible for calculating the possible (legal) moves for a given position. The means for accomplishing the task is the static method moveGenerator() which takes a Position object as its single parameter and returns a set of Move objects each of which represent a possible move. The class also contains other static methods, many of which are public. All the methods of the class contribute to the move generation process and operations in one way or the other.
    Author:
    Henrik Lindberg

    • Method Detail

      • moveGenerator

        public static Set<Move> moveGenerator(Position pos)
                               throws Exception
        Generates the set of possible (legal) moves for a given position. This is one of the fundamental mechanisms of Chessosis. A lot of effort should and will be invested in testing this method.
        Parameters:
        pos - the Position object to examine
        Returns:
        a set of zero or more Move objects
        Throws:
        Exception

      • pawnsSquares

        public static EnumSet<Square> pawnsSquares(Square sq,
                                           Colour pawnColor)
                                    throws Exception
        Returns the pawn's squares associated with the given square and piece color. Pawn's squares mean the squares on which a pawn could capture a piece. For example, the pawn's squares of E4 are {D5, F5} for a white pawn and {D3, F3} for a black one.
        Parameters:
        sq - square to operate on
        pawnColor - the pawn's squares are in part determined by piece color
        Returns:
        a set of zero, one or two squares
        Throws:
        Exception

      • knightsSquares

        public static EnumSet<Square> knightsSquares(Square sq)
                                      throws Exception
        Returns the knight's squares of the given square parameter. For example, with the square parameter value E4 the method would return the set {F6, G5, G3, F2, D2, C3, C5, D6}. Think of the method as applying to the movement of a knight on an empty chessboard.
        Parameters:
        sq - the square to operate on
        Returns:
        a set of up to eight squares
        Throws:
        Exception

      • rooksSquares

        public static EnumSet<Square> rooksSquares(Square sq)
                                    throws Exception
        Returns the rook's squares of the square parameter. The rook's squares mean the squares to which a rook could move to on an empty board.
        Parameters:
        sq - the square to operate on
        Returns:
        a set of 14 squares
        Throws:
        Exception

      • kingsSquares

        public static EnumSet<Square> kingsSquares(Square sq)
                                    throws Exception
        Return the king's squares of the square parameter. They are the squares to which a king could move to from its current square on an empty board.
        Parameters:
        sq - the current square of a king
        Returns:
        a set of up to eight squares
        Throws:
        Exception
